DOC.brief_title: Testing Whether Brief Use Virtual Reality Device Improves Gait
DOC.detailed_description: Older adult risk recurrent fall . This study involve single study session ( last two hour ) control set research laboratory . This study evaluate whether old adult unintentional fall willing enroll kind study , use device briefly , undergo research assessment . The study also test whether use virtual reality device lead detectable change gait , balance , mobility confidence . This study lay groundwork comprehensive study future assess clinical impact use device . Twenty-four subject recruit . They include equal number older adult : ( 1 ) fall without significant injury ( e.g . minor contusion , laceration ) ( 2 ) fall significant injury ( e.g . dislocation , strain/sprain , fracture ) heal prior enrollment . Each subject complete baseline measure gait , balance , confidence . Then introduce virtual reality device use brief period . Gait balance test , first virtual reality device , finally , without virtual reality device . The device ( GaitAidÂ® ) , develop co-investigator Yoram Baram , Ph.D. , already use rehabilitation neurological patient ( e.g . Parkinson 's Disease ) . The device train tool NOT continuous walk aid .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Age 60+ . 2 . Englishspeaking . 3 . One unintentional fall past year . 4 . Able ambulate least 10 minute without continuous assistance , i.e. , without human physical assistance without assistive device walker , cane . 5 . A moderate high level concern fall ( determine phone screen PI ) . 6 . Community dwell . 7 . Diagnosed neurological disease , i.e. , sensory ataxia , cerebellar ataxia , spasticity lower limb . 8 . Diagnosed Parkinson 's Disease . 9 . Diagnosed Multiple Sclerosis . 10 . Diagnosed Cerebral Palsy . 11 . Marked cognitive impairment . 12 . Uses large eyeglass walk . 13 . Vision condition reduce ability use device . 14 . Severe hearing loss . 15 . Unstable medical condition terminal illness . 16 . Inability otherwise comply study procedure ( determine PI/study clinician ) .
